generalCommands.verify:
The */verify* command and its subcommands let you verify your own Cardano address and will enable features like automatic role-assignments based on delegation and token roles.
**Important:** üí° The admins of this Discord will *not* be able to see any of your verified addresses. They can only see addresses that you register for a whitelist! Your security always comes first.
generalCommands.verify-add:
With */verify add* you can add a new address to your list of verified wallets. Issuing the command will ask you to send a specific amount of ADA to yourself within a specific amount of time. If the transaction is confirmed this verifies your wallet and allows the system to also verify token and NFT ownership. A wallet can only be registered with one Discord user at one time.
‚ùï You can also provide a handle for verification - it will automatically be resolved into an address.
üí° Verifying a wallet will link the Discord server on which you are performing the verification as part of the process, so no explicit */verify link* is needed.
generalCommands.verify-help: This command, which will print out information on how to use the */verify* feature.
generalCommands.verify-link: When you first join a server, all your verified addresses will not be linked by default. This means your privacy comes first and you will not be assigned any roles without authorizing it via */verify link*. This command will enable this bot to assign automatic roles and use other features on this specific Discord server for your account.
generalCommands.verify-list: When using */verify list*, all your open and confirmed verifications will be listed. If you ever get disconnected during a verification process, you can retrieve the info needed to verify here. This command also lets you cancel your open verification, if needed.
generalCommands.verify-remove: If you want to remove a verified address from your account, simply use */verify remove* and the wallet will not be used for any token roles or other features on any of your link Discord servers any more.
generalCommands.verify-unlink: If you would like to unlink a wallet from a specific Discord server, because you wish to not receive automatic role-assignments or other treatment that might reveal anything about you, use the */verify unlink* command.
generalCommands.profile: Change your profile information and account settings.
generalCommands.vote: Participate in a poll on this Discord server.
generalCommands.ping: Ping the owner of an NFT, address or staking address via a private message, without knowing their name.
generalCommands.premium: See your premium status and $HAZEL balance, as well as pledge your stake to your Discord server.

stakepoolCommands.info: The */info* command gives you some basic information about the server and lists any official stakepools of the server, if it has any set up.

nftCommands.policyid: If this server has any official Cardano policy IDs and corresponding projects, they will be displayed when you use the */policyid* command. These policies can be for both fungible tokens and NFTs.

whitelistCommands.whitelist: You can use the */whitelist* command to see which whitelists are available on this server (via the *list* subcommand), or register and unregister from whitelists you qualified for via the respective *register* and *unregister* subcommands.

adminCommands.title: The following are commands for administrators only (normal users do not get this text when using */help*)
adminCommands.configure-bans: With */configure-bans* you can manage ban settings on your server, which allow exclusion of users, wallets or tokens from the server or role assignments/participation.
adminCommands.configure-protection: With */configure-protection* you can view and set up the scam and fake protection of the bot. It will let you set up automatic removal of messages with **addr1** as content, as well as an optional auditing of such messages to a dedicated channel for moderators.
adminCommands.configure-settings: Under */configure-settings* you can find subcommands that let you customize and control your bot to match your projects needs.
adminCommands.configure-stakepool: */configure-stakepool* provides commands to add, list and remove stakepools for this Discord server. These are needed if you intend to set up delegator roles or if you want your pool information to be listed via the */info* command.
adminCommands.configure-delegatorroles: Once you have set up your official stakepool information via */configure-stakepool* you can assign roles based on delegation to specific pools. You will need the pool hash or you can reference "all official pools of this Discord" by leaving the pool hash parameter empty.
adminCommands.configure-policy: With */configure-policy* you can set up official policy IDs that users can inspect and easily find via the public */policyids* command.
adminCommands.configure-tokenroles: The */configure-tokenroles* command will allow you to set up automatic role assignments for users that have tokens of specific policies in their verified staking addresses. Users can verify via the public */verify* command.
adminCommands.configure-whitelist: With this command you can manage whitelists on this server that people can register for via the public */whitelist* command.
adminCommands.configure-adminaccess: The */configure-adminaccess* command allows you to manage which users can access administrative functions of the bot, like all the */configure* commands.
adminCommands.configure-poll: The */configure-poll* command enables the creation and management of polls and helps admins set up votings on their server, open or restricted to token-holders.
adminCommands.configure-healthcheck: With */configure-healthcheck* you can find out if there are any obvious misconfigurations or issues present in your bot that prevent normal operations.
adminCommands.configure-marketplace: Using */configure-marketplace* allows you to create sales, listing and mint trackers and configure them with rules for metadata and rarity information.
adminCommands.start: The */start* command is what you use to set the bot up initially, but also what you can use to reset your bot features and what you might be asked to run if new capabilities get added to the bot.

This is the official list of projects that are related to this server. This does not mean that this is the official Discord for the respective projects, but that the administrators of this server added them as policies here.
üí° Please verify on the respective project website, if you are on their official Discord server before following any buy links etc.

claim.purpose:
If you've minted a specific NFT or participated in an event or whitelist, you may be eligible to claim physical items. This command will let you pick your items and will then ask you for your shipping address via DM.
üí° The system is opaque for the Discord operators and while they will receive your shipping address, they will not be provided with the associated stake address, keeping your personal data private.
claim.availableClaimLists: The following claim lists are available. Select your list and make sure you can receive direct messages from the bot, so it can ask you for your physical address.
claim.chooseClaimList: Choose what you want to claim
claim.claimProductDetails: You can claim this item {{available}} times.
claim.orderStarted: ‚è≥ Please check your direct messages from <@{{botUser}}> to finalize your order process.
claim.checkout: ‚Ñπ Please choose the items you would like to claim. Below is a list of total claimable items - the bot will guide you through selecting the available choices for each of your items.
claim.existingOrder: üí° We have found an existing order for this claim list and <@{{botUser}}> has sent you the details. You can verify your order in your direct messages. Contact the project team, should you need to change your order.
claim.enterShipTo: ‚úç Please enter your full name for your ship to address:
claim.enterPhone: üìû For international orders, we need your phone number, including country code:
claim.enterCity: üèô Please enter your city name (and state, if applicable):
claim.enterStreet: üõ£ Please enter your full street address, including house number, apartment etc.:
claim.addressEntryComplete:
‚òë Address entry complete. Please verify your shopping cart contents and address information.
üí° Once submitted, your order can only be changed by contacting the project team.
claim.checkoutComplete: ‚òë You have successfully submitted your order. You can see your order details by running the */claim* command again in your respective Discord server. The project team will be in touch with updates on the delivery.
claim.checkoutError: ‚ö† There was an error submitting your order. We apologize for the inconvenience. We suggest to start the process via */claim* once more, as there can be problems if the order entry takes longer than 15 minutes overall from the initial claim to completion. If the error persists on the second attempt we ecommend getting in touch with the project team. Make sure to write down the current time and time zone, so we can find the problem easier.
claim.noCurrentOrderProcess: ‚ö† Sorry, there is no current order active, so I cannot respond properly. If you are reacting to an older message please start the order process again in the respective Discord by running */claim*.
claim.noDirectMessage: ‚ö† The bot is not able to send you a direct message, which means it will not be able to collect your shipping address. Please click on the server name, select **Privacy Settings** and enable **Allow direct messages from server members**. You can disable it again after the claim process is complete.
claim.noClaimLists:
*Currently, you do not qualify for any claim lists.*

‚Ñπ If you think you qualify, make sure your respective staking address is verified and linked via the */verify list*, */verify add* and */verify link* commands.
claim.helpChannel: If you need assistance with your order, please get in touch with our team in the channel <#{{helpChannel}}>. We are happy to help you out.
claim.trackingNumberDetails: Your tracking number is **{{trackingNumber}}** and you can follow it via this [Google Search](https://www.google.com/search?q={{trackingNumber}}). If the search does not yield any results, reach out to the project team to get your shipping provider.
claim.orderOnline: The project team has provided the following URL to get your order and shipping details ready. Thanks for supporting this project!:

send.purpose: You are about to send a message via HAZELnet to the user associated with your recipient **{{targetShort}}**.
send.success:
‚úÖ You have successfully pinged the user associated with your recipient **{{targetShort}}**.

üí° Please be aware that the recipient can choose to ignore your message - this does not mean it was not delivered. We take the privacy of our users extremely seriously and discourage the recipient to respond to suspicious messages or spam. If you are reported for abusing the system, your account may be suspended.
send.messageContentEmpty: The ping message will just provide your Discord handle and server you are sending the message from.
send.messageContent:
The ping message will include your Discord handle and server you are sending the message from, as well as the following text:

{{{message}}}
send.clickBelowToSend: üëá Click below to confirm you want to send your ping.

We take the privacy of our users extremely seriously and discourage the recipient to respond to suspicious messages or spam. If you are reported for abusing the system, your account may be suspended.
send.pingLimitStandard: üí° You can currently ping once every 24 hours. If you would like to ping more frequently, considering staking with our partner pool by running the command **/premium**. Any staked amount will give you access to a Black Edition account tier and support the development of this project.
send.pingLimitPremium: üêà Thanks for supporting HAZELnet with your stake! Your Black Edition account allows you to ping a user once every 60 minutes.
send.invalidHandle: ‚ö† The handle (*{{target}}*) does not look like a valid handle. It has to start with $ and can have at most 15 characters. Please provide a valid handle to ping.
send.invalidAssetFingerprint: ‚ö† The asset (*{{target}}*) does not look like a valid asset fingerprint (starts with asset1 and has 44 characters total). Please provide a valid asset fingerprint to ping.
send.invalidAddress: ‚ö† The address (*{{target}}*) does not look like a valid wallet address (starts with addr1 and has 103 characters total) or staking address (starts with stake1). Please provide a correct address to ping.
send.pingTargetNotFound: ‚ö† Unfortunately, the submitted target *{{targetShort}}* is not associated with a verified stake address within our system and could not be pinged.
send.pingTooOften: ‚ö† We are limiting pinging users to prevent abuse. Please wait {{waitTime}} {{waitUnits}} until you can ping again.
send.tooLongMessage: ‚ö† Your ping message can be at most {{maxMessageLength}} characters long - please write a shorter message.
send.messageContainsUnsafePhrases: ‚ö† Ping messages are not allowed to contain addresses, URLs or handles for the safety of the recipient. Please adjust your ping message accordingly.
send.pingOtherError: ‚ö† An unknown error ocurred trying to ping the desired target. We apologize for the inconvenience and suggest reaching out to the project team for help.
send.failedTimeout: ‚ö† This ping is no longer available. Please create a new ping.
send.reportPing: Report this ping as a scam attempt
send.pingRecipientText: The user <@{{sender}}> has pinged you from the server *{{{guildName}}}*. They have used the {{targetType}} **{{target}}** to reach you and did not receive any Discord information about you. You can decide to respond by contacting them on the respective Discord server or messaging them directly.
send.pingRecipientMessageTitle: They have attached the following message
send.pingRecipientAdditionalContent:
‚ö† We highly recommend to not react to any messages that look suspicious to you. Never start an escrow based on Discord messages or send any funds. Use websites like jpg.store and tradingtent.io to safely trade assets.

üí° If you would like to turn off message pings, simply run the command **/profile toggle** in any HAZELnet-enabled Discord to turn off the feature. You can always list recent pings via **/ping list** (even if message-pings are disabled).
send.reportContent: Thank you for reporting this ping. We will continually investigate repeat-offenders and start blocking their access to the ping feature if abuse is confirmed.

Here you can set your default ADA Handle that people will see when they look up your account, or turn the default off.

üí° If your ADA Handle does not appear in this list (it can show a maximum of 25), please run the command again, with the *handle* parameter set to your preferred default handle.

add.previewPhase1:
Welcome to the new poll wizard üßô‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è! We will walk you through creating a new poll for your server.
‚ö† We highly suggest only running this command in a private channel as you will be asked to type messages to populate the description and voting options later on.

You've configured the following initial settings for your poll:
add.previewPhase1NoChannel: You have not selected a channel for the bot to post a voting announcement in at poll open time.
add.previewPhase1Channel: The bot will post a voting announcement in <#{{publishChannel}}> once the poll opens.
add.previewPhase1NoRequiredRole: No role requirements are in effect - everybody will be able to see the poll.
add.previewPhase1RequiredRole: To view and participate in the vote, users will need to be assigned the <@&{{requiredRole}}> role. You can additional roles via the */configure-poll update* command later.
add.previewPhase1NextSteps: ‚ùó Please send a message to this current channel (<#{{currentChannel}}>) in the next 5 minutes, containing the description for your poll that you would like to use:
add.previewPhase3NextSteps: ‚ùó Please send up to ten messages to this current channel (<#{{currentChannel}}>) containing your voting options and add a reaction with your desired emote to each message:
add.previewPhase4NextSteps: ‚ùó Please select some final settings for your poll. If you choose token ownership to be required, a final step will ask you for information about the voting snapshot
add.isPublicVote: Are results publicly viewable before the vote ends?
add.publicVoteYesDescription: Voting results are publicly visible via /vote
add.publicVoteNoDescription: Voting results are hidden until manually published
add.isMultipleVotes: Can users vote for more than one option at once?
add.multipleVoteYesDescription: Users can select multiple voting options
add.multipleVoteNoDescription: Users can only select one choice
add.isTokenOwnershipRequired: Can only token holders vote in this poll?
add.tokenTypeHolderOnlyDescription: Yes, each holder gets one vote
add.tokenTypeHolderWeightedDescription: Yes, holders get votes based on owned number of tokens
add.previewPhase5NextStepsPolicyIdOnly: Only people that are verified owners of tokens from the policy *{{policyId}}* can vote.
add.previewPhase5NextStepsPolicyIdAndFingerp:
Only people that are verified owners of tokens from the policy *{{policyId}}* with the asset fingerprint *{{assetFingerprint}}* can vote.
‚ö† The ownership snapshot will be made in the next ten minutes after this poll is created.
add.previewPhase5NextStepsWeighted: The voting power will be based on the amount of tokens. If multiple selections can be made, the total voting power will be evenly distributed across all choices (rounded down).
add.previewPhase5NextSteps: ‚ùó Please enter the policy ID of the token that voters will be voting with. If using fungible tokens, we also recommend to provide the asset fingerprint, separated with a plus from the policy ID, as follows: *489aa3378d13c87ad4e595ab2a9092e9c92bd645b725b853a3cdebf3+asset1acqu7skxpaj2k5kgnvpk96yclag4nfw48zkpek*
add.success: ‚úÖ New poll with the following settings added to this server:
add.errorTimeout: The poll wizard üßô‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è timed out waiting for your input, sorry. Please restart the wizard via the */configure-poll add* command.
add.errorPolicyFormat:
The format of either the policy ID, the asset fingerprint, or both are incorrect.
Valid policy IDs have 56 alphanumberic characters.
Asset fingerprints look as follows: *asset1acqu7skxpaj2k5kgnvpk96yclag4nfw48zkpek*

Have a great day!
Your HAZELnet team

add.previewPhase1:
Welcome to the new giveaway wizard üßô‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è! We will walk you through creating a new giveaway for your server.
‚ö† We highly suggest only running this command in a private channel as you will be asked to type messages to populate the description and options later on.

You've configured the following initial settings for your giveaway:
add.previewPhase1DetailsOpenTime: **Giveaway start time**: Users will be able to start participating at <t:{{timestamp}}>
add.previewPhase1DetailsCloseTime: **Giveaway end time**: Users can participate until <t:{{timestamp}}>
add.previewPhase1DetailsSnapshotTime: **Snapshot time**: The token snapshot for this poll will be done at <t:{{timestamp}}>
add.previewPhase1NoChannel: You have not selected a channel for the bot to post a giveaway announcement in at giveaway start time.
add.previewPhase1Channel: The bot will post a giveaway announcement in <#{{publishChannel}}> once the giveaway starts.
add.previewPhase1NoRequiredRole: No role requirements are in effect - everybody will be able to see the giveaway.
add.previewPhase1RequiredRole: To participate in the giveaway, users will need to be assigned the <@&{{requiredRole}}> role. You can additional roles via the */configure-giveaway update* command later.
add.previewPhase1NextSteps: ‚ùó Please send a message to this current channel (<#{{currentChannel}}>) in the next 5 minutes, containing the description for your giveaway that you would like to use:
add.previewPhase3NextSteps: ‚ùó Please select some final settings for your giveaway. If you choose token ownership to be required, a final step will ask you for information about the giveaway snapshot
add.isUniqueWinners: Every drawn winner must be unique?
add.uniqueWinnersYesDescription: Every user can win at most once
add.uniqueWinnersNoDescription: Users can win multiple times if they have more than one entry
add.drawTypeDiscordIdDescription: The winners Discord ID and tag will be shown
add.drawTypeWalletAddressDescription: The winners wallet address will be shown
add.isTokenOwnershipRequired: Can only token holders participate in this giveaway?
add.tokenTypeHolderOnlyDescription: Yes, each holder gets one entry
add.tokenTypeHolderWeightedDescription: Yes, holders get entries based on owned number of tokens
add.previewPhase4NextStepsPolicyIdOnly: Only people that are verified owners of tokens from the policy *{{policyId}}* can participate.
add.previewPhase4NextStepsPolicyIdAndFingerp: Only people that are verified owners of tokens from the policy *{{policyId}}* with the asset fingerprint *{{assetFingerprint}}* can participate.
add.previewPhase4NextStepsWeighted: The entry count will be based on the amount of tokens.
add.previewPhase4NextSteps: ‚ùó Please enter the policy ID of the token that entrants will be participating with. If using fungible tokens, we also recommend to provide the asset fingerprint, separated with a plus from the policy ID, as follows: *489aa3378d13c87ad4e595ab2a9092e9c92bd645b725b853a3cdebf3+asset1acqu7skxpaj2k5kgnvpk96yclag4nfw48zkpek*
add.noSnapshotTimeProvided: ‚ö† No snapshot time provided. The snapshot will be taken within the next thirty minutes.
add.success: ‚úÖ New giveaway with the following settings added to this server:
add.errorTimeout: The giveaway wizard üßô‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è timed out waiting for your input, sorry. Please restart the wizard via the */configure-giveaway add* command.
add.errorPolicyFormat:
The format of either the policy ID, the asset fingerprint, or both are incorrect.
Valid policy IDs have 56 alphanumberic characters.
Asset fingerprints look as follows: *asset1acqu7skxpaj2k5kgnvpk96yclag4nfw48zkpek*

start.configureMessage: The /start command will help you set up your HAZELnet bot. Select your options below:
start.configureLanguageText: This setting determines the language of all bot commands and interactions. Currently it is not possible to have commands translate on a per-user basis - bot replies will in the future be able to be based on a user-selected language.
start.configureAdminRoleText: All users with the admin role will be able to configure the bot. Admins can set official stakepools, policies and automatic role-assignments. Expose these abilities to as few people as possible. The guild owner will always have access to all commands, regardless of this setting. If you have more than 25 roles, only your first 25 will be shown here. Use the */configure-adminaccess* command to adjust this later.
start.configureFeaturesText: The features that you enable will determine which commands are available to users and administrators. Depending on which features you turn on, you will have different capabilities available. Certain features require a premium subscription called **Black Edition**. See our website for more information.
start.chooseFeatures: Choose all of the features you want to use
start.selectedAdminRoles: The users with the following roles will be able to configure the bot:
start.selectedUserRoles: The users with the following roles will be able to verify their wallets and interact with the bot:
start.selectedFeatures:
You have selected the following features:

{{{selectedFeatureList}}}
start.setupRoleWarningMessage:
**Your setup is complete with warnings**:

‚ùó Please be aware the bot did not find all the necessary permissions through roles assigned to it. Make sure the bot has one or multiple roles that grant at least the following permissions: Send Messages, Read Messages, Manage Messages, Manage Roles

üí° Make sure the bot role is high enough in the Discord role list, so it can assign any auto-assign roles it is configured to manage.
start.setupCompleteMessage:
**Your setup is complete!**

üëâ Make sure the bot role is high enough so it can assign any auto-assign roles it is configured to manage.

‚Ñπ Make sure you also disable/enable the correct commands by going to "Server Settings" - "Integrations", selecting HAZELnet and setting the permissions for **/configure-** commands for your selected admin role, and enable the user-facing commands for your normal users.
start.nextStepsDetails:
You are now ready to start adding token roles, verification widgets, and more‚Ä¶

If you are not sure where to start, some common first steps are adding a verification widget **/configure-verify announce** and adding your first token role via **/configure-tokenroles add**. You can click *Click for help* at the top of each command to get detailed info, run **/help** to see what is available, or just browse our documentation to learn more at https://www.hazelnet.io/documentation

features.token: Fungible tokens and NFTs (official policies, token roles)
features.poll: Polls and voting system for open and holder-limited polls
features.pollvoteaire: Integration with the on-chain voting tool Voteaire
features.giveaway: Custom and weighted giveaways for your community
features.quiz: Build custom quizzes for your community
features.claimphysical: Claiming physical items via verified lists
features.marketplace: Marketplace integrations, listings, minting, and sales trackers
features.engagement: Various tools to track and improve community engagement

about.title: About HAZELnet
about.info:
The HAZELnet Discord Community System was proudly built by the operators of HAZEL stakepool. We appreciate all our delegators and would love your support on our mission to improve feline lives.

If you would like this Discord bot in your server for free, visit https://www.hazelnet.io or https://twitter.com/HAZELnet_io
